intro: Sauropus subterblancus, commonly known as the silver shield fern, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its striking silver-white variegated leaves. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or terrestrial shrub, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed and can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by red berries, making it both ornamental and ecologically significant.
